sentences.en: A person who does a regrettable action is often regretful afterwards.
sentences.cn: 行为不检点的人,日后往往懊悔.

sentences.en: Even those regrettable types seemed trivial enough to be laughed out of sight -- and forgotten.
sentences.cn: 甚至这类令人遗憾的作品也显得无足轻重,不妨 一笑置之,淡忘了事.

sentences.en: He spoke of this as a regrettable lapse into political exoticism on his part.
sentences.cn: 他把这件发生在身上的事作为一桩不幸的落入政治上的异国情调的失足来谈论.

sentences.en: Her rudeness was most / highly regrettable.
His tiredness caused him to make a regrettable error.
sentences.cn: 他由于疲劳而犯了个令人遗憾的错误.

sentences.en: It is highly regrettable that the minister cannot be here in person.
sentences.cn: 很遗憾,部长不能亲自出席.

sentences.en: It is regrettable that our appeal a dead letter.
sentences.cn: 遗憾的是,我们当时的呼吁石沉大海.

sentences.en: It is regrettable that we never speak seriously.
sentences.cn: 遗憾的是我们从没认真谈过.

sentences.en: On December 2,1943, a most regrettable and disturbing incident took place at the port of Ban.
sentences.cn: 一九四三年十二月二日, 巴利港口发生一件非常骚动而伤心的事.

sentences.en: South Korea's Unification Ministry called the North Korean decision regrettable.
sentences.cn: 南韩统一部称北朝鲜的决议是让人遗憾的.

sentences.en: The ignorance of a director of this large organization is regrettable.
sentences.cn: 如此大的组织的总监的无知是令人遗憾的.

sentences.en: The reason behind decisions we must make today is regrettable.
sentences.cn: 想到今日吾人非做出决定不可的原因,大家都引以为憾.

sentences.en: This was a very regrettable error.
sentences.cn: 这是个令人很遗憾的错误。

sentences.en: To this small but increasingly strident group a victory for Hanoi was not regrettable.
sentences.cn: 这些激进分子人数虽少,但越来越尖刻,对他们来说,河内的胜利并非憾事.

sentences.en: Visitor A : Oh, it's so regrettable! How about the small pavilion nearby?
sentences.cn: 瞻仰者 A: 啊, 太缺憾了! 那足下?掌握那个小馆呢?

sentences.en: Your choice of friends is regrettable.
sentences.cn: 你对朋友的选择实在不怎么样.

words.tran_cn: 令人遗憾的；可惜的；可悲的；抱歉的

trans.tran_cn: 令人遗憾的，可惜的，可悲的，抱歉的
trans.tran_en: something that is regrettable is unpleasant, and you wish things could be different
